newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.KOREAN WON ENDS WEAKER ON LOOMING IMPORTER DEALS.
newsitem.headline: S.KOREAN WON ENDS WEAKER ON LOOMING IMPORTER DEALS.

text.p: The won closed lower on Friday on aggressive dollar buying interest in preparation of import account settlements due early next week, dealers said.
They said the strengthening yen against the dollar in Tokyo had no impact on the won/dollar market.

The won finished at 894.30, compared with Thursday's close of 892.80. After opening at 893.30, the won fell to the monthly low of 894.50 on anticipation that huge amounts of importer deals would be settled early next week.
But fears of central bank interventions limited further falls in the local currency, dealers said.
A central bank official forecast range trading next week as dollar demand and supply would be well balanced despite importer deal settlements.
"There is no reason for dealers to react nervously," he said.
Monday's mid-rate is expected to be fixed at 893.80 against 892.80 today.
